summary: Rename direction changed: app should remain/return to TruckTrackAfrica (instead of TruckTrackLoads). Client load posting should use Loading Location (Pick Up) and Offloading Location (Drop Off) terminology for the origin/destination fields.
architectural_notes: Enforce admin-only publish/approval gate before any load/post becomes visible/live.
Support transporter document upload + storage for a fixed checklist of compliance documents.
Payments must support configurable milestone-based terms (e.g., deposit + balance, COD) chosen per client request and driven by admin-configured account details.
Admin dashboard must include a mechanism to paste/store ad codes for display placement.
Do not hardcode admin credentials; seed initial admin user via environment/secure setup and store hashed passwords. Support changing/resetting credentials via admin/user management.
Tracking should be implemented in phases: manual updates first; design tracking data model/interfaces to allow later GPS integration without breaking clients.

Plan for Android release packaging: generate signed release builds (APK/AAB) suitable for Google Play submission; keep signing keys/keystore material out of source control and managed via secure environment/secrets.
Standardize weight units as tonnage (tons) in data model/UI validations to avoid mixed-unit ambiguity.
known_issues: Security risk: user requested a fixed admin username/password; must not store or deploy plaintext credentials.

existing_features.title: Implement site navigation and routing for the required pages: Home, About Us (Company Profile), Services, Load Board, Transporter Registration, Client Registration, Contact Us, and Admin Dashboard.

Create the Home page with: logo and tagline, a brief introduction to Molele & Co PTY LTD, call-to-action buttons for Transporter Registration and Client Registration, and a testimonials section (client and transporter testimonials).

Create About Us and Services pages with English content matching the provided topics, including coverage areas (South Africa, Zimbabwe, Zambia, Botswana, Namibia, Tanzania) and the listed service offerings.
Create a Contact Us page with a contact form and company contact details section. Store submitted contact messages in the backend so admins can view them in the Admin Dashboard.

Implement secure authentication for three roles: Client, Transporter, and Admin. Support login/registration for clients and transporters, and admin authentication for the Admin Dashboard. Enforce role-based access control across UI and backend methods.

Implement Transporter Registration with the required form fields and required document submissions: GIT, Horse Registration documents, Trailer 1 documents, Trailer 2 documents, tracker certificate, tracker logins, company registration, and bank confirmation. Store uploaded documents as assets (e.g., base64/blob) in the backend linked to the transporter profile, with admin-only access to view/download.
Implement Client Registration with the required fields (company details, contact person info, and load requirements) and persist client profiles in the backend.

Build the Load Board feature: clients can create load requests with the specified fields (load type, truck type & quantity, origin & destination, weight & dimensions, pickup & delivery dates, contact information) and view their own loads. Transporters can browse approved/live loads.

Add an admin review/approval workflow so that loads (and any other public posts/content intended to be public) are not visible publicly until an admin reviews and makes them live. Include admin actions to approve/reject and optionally request changes.
Implement Tracking: allow transporters to post status updates and location updates for a load they are assigned to (or otherwise linked to). Show clients a tracking timeline/status for their loads.

Create an Admin Dashboard with: user management (clients/transporters), load management (view/edit/delete/approve), transporter management (view/edit/delete including documents), contact message inbox, basic analytics/reporting (at minimum: counts of users, loads by status, recent activity), and content management for editable website content sections.

Add an Admin Dashboard section to manage ad code snippets: admin can paste, save, and enable/disable ad code blocks (e.g., HTML/JS snippets) that render in configured placements on the public site. Sanitize and restrict ad code rendering to reduce XSS risk (e.g., allowlist placement and display within sandboxed iframe where feasible).
Ensure the entire website (public pages, registration flows, load board, dashboards) is responsive and mobile-friendly with accessible form layouts and readable typography.

Apply a coherent, professional visual theme across the site (colors, typography, spacing, component styles) suitable for a Southern Africa logistics/freight brand. Avoid blue/purple as the primary palette.

Add generated brand images as static assets and use them in the UI: include the TruckTrack Africa logo and a home hero/banner visual. Store generated images under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them directly from the frontend.

Rename the application from "TruckTrack Africa" to "TruckTrackLoads" in all user-facing UI text and metadata (including the HTML document title), while keeping all existing routes and functionality unchanged.
Update public-facing company contact details to use: phone "+27712671212" and email "moleleholdings101@gmail.com" wherever contact details are displayed (Contact page and footer if applicable).

Replace the About page hero/intro and story/mission content so it matches the provided English copy for Molele & Co PTY LTD and TruckTrack Africa text, while preserving the existing page structure (sections/cards) and keeping it readable and well-formatted.

Add client load confirmation details to the Load Board "Post a Load" flow by capturing (a) a purchase order / order number text field and (b) an optional upload of one or more confirmation documents, and persist these values with the load so admins can review them during load approval.

Implement a bottom-of-app ad placement that displays a configurable ad snippet at the bottom of public pages, and preconfigure the bottom ad placement using the provided AdMob identifiers: "ca-app-pub-1142092266888748/3770766456" and "ca-app-pub-1142092266888748~1123479863" (store them exactly as provided).

Add a secure admin access approach that does NOT store or deploy a fixed plaintext username/password; ensure admin access remains protected via the existing authentication system and allow admin activities (approving loads and other admin actions) only for authenticated admins.

Refine the BottomAd component UX so the bottom ad placement is less intrusive and behaves well on mobile and desktop: add a visible "Advertisement" label, lazy-load the iframe, improve spacing/height constraints for small screens, and add a user-dismiss (collapse/close) control that persists per-session (so users do not have to close it repeatedly).

Improve the admin login/access guidance in the UI so users understand how to sign in for admin and what to do if they are not authorized: update the /admin gated experience to (1) prompt unauthenticated users to sign in using Internet Identity and (2) clearly explain that admin access requires an authorized account, with the existing support email for access requests.

Ensure the /admin page has a robust, user-friendly access gate with exactly three states: (1) while authentication/role checks are loading, show a loading state; (2) when the user is not authenticated, show an admin sign-in prompt that instructs the user to sign in with Internet Identity; (3) when the user is authenticated but not an admin, show an access-denied screen explaining that admin access is restricted and providing the support email moleleholdings101@gmail.com.

After a user signs in from the /admin gate (AdminSignInPrompt), return them to /admin automatically (rather than leaving them on the previous page), so the admin check re-runs and the correct screen (dashboard vs access-denied) is shown immediately.

Make admin access troubleshooting clearer on /admin by ensuring the unauthenticated prompt and the authenticated-but-not-admin screen both clearly state that admin access requires an authorized account and instruct the user to contact moleleholdings101@gmail.com for access requests.

Add a developer-facing documentation note that clearly identifies the key frontend files responsible for the /admin route, the admin access gate behavior (loading / unauthenticated / non-admin denied), and the Admin Dashboard UI implementation.

Update the default bottom ad snippet configuration so it includes everything required for an AdMob/Google Ads snippet to render when injected via the BottomAd iframe (srcDoc), including loading the required external script if needed.

Add a basic ad-rendering diagnostic state to the BottomAd component so it is easier to verify whether the ad snippet is executing (e.g., show a subtle inline message inside the ad container when the iframe fails to load or when the snippet is empty/disabled).

In the Admin Dashboard ad settings tab, add an embedded preview of the current bottom-ad snippet using the same iframe sandboxing approach as BottomAd so admins can quickly confirm what will render before saving/enabling.

Add developer documentation that explains how to produce an Android release artifact for this app (APK for testing and AAB for Play Store), including prerequisites, build commands, versioning steps, and where the generated files can be found after the build completes.

Add repository scripts/configuration necessary to reproducibly generate the Android build artifacts described in the documentation (including a signed release build flow that does not commit any secrets/keystores into the repository).

Revert the application name from "TruckTrackLoads" back to "TruckTrackAfrica" in all user-facing UI text and metadata (including the HTML document title), while keeping all existing routes and functionality unchanged.

Update the client "Post a Load" flow so clients must provide separate fields for "Loading Location (Pick Up)" and "Offloading Location (Drop Off)", and persist these values with each load so they are visible anywhere loads are reviewed or displayed (client views, transporter load board browsing, and admin load review).

Add an always-visible "Admin" navigation link/button in the site header that routes to "/admin" so users can easily find the admin sign-in/access gate (do not require the user to already be an admin to see the link).
Add an "Admin" link under the Footer "Quick Links" section that routes to the admin page using the app’s hash-based routing format ("/#/admin").

Add “Democratic Republic of Congo” to every public-facing “Coverage Areas / countries we provide services” list (including About page, Services page, and Footer coverage text) while keeping the existing layout and styling consistent.

Update the Client Registration and Transporter Registration forms to capture “Contract Details” (English label) and persist it to the backend, without changing existing required fields or the document upload requirements.

Add spreadsheet-style tables to the Admin Dashboard to view all registered Transporters and all registered Clients, including contract details, and provide a CSV export/download action for each table.
Add an admin-configurable Android APK download link setting stored in the backend, and display it prominently on the Admin Dashboard as a clickable download link.

Standardize load weight entry and display to tonnage (tons) across the Load Board and Admin Dashboard: update labels, input hints, and rendered units so users see and enter weight in tons instead of kilograms.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build core marketing site pages (Home, About, Services, Contact) with logo/tagline, CTAs, and testimonials
Implement Load Board with client load posting fields (type, truck needs, origin/destination, weight/dimensions, dates, contact)
Client registration and secure authentication (login/registration)
Transporter registration with detailed profile plus required document uploads (GIT, horse registration, trailers 1&2 docs, tracker certificate/logins, company registration, bank confirmation)
Admin dashboard for user/loads/transporters management, content management, analytics/reporting, and ability to paste/manage ad codes
Admin review/approval workflow so only admin can make loads/posts live
Tracking feature allowing transporters to update load status and location
Payments workflow with configurable terms (50/50, 70/30, COD, pay-on-arrival, post-delivery) selectable by clients; admin-configured payout/account details
Responsive/mobile-friendly design across all pages and dashboards

Implement payment terms selection and payment state tracking for client load requests: clients choose payment method/terms (50/50, 70/30, COD, and pay-on-arrival/on-site). Admin can configure and display the company payment/account details in Admin Dashboard, and the system records milestones (e.g., truck on site, delivered) and whether payment is pending/confirmed based on the chosen terms.
Add in-app ad units displayed at the bottom of the app using provided Google AdMob IDs
Client load confirmation details/documents: capture purchase order/order number and/or upload confirmation docs as part of load requests
Add Google social login alongside email/password (JWT) authentication
Phase tracking: start with manual transporter status/location updates; plan later GPS-based real-time tracking integration
Refine bottom ad unit behavior and/or placement (UX/layout adjustments) after initial deployment
Provide an Android APK build for download and guidance/support for publishing the app to the Google Play Store (release packaging/signing as needed)
Rename/keep the app branding as "TruckTrackAfrica" (revert any "TruckTrackLoads" naming in UI text and metadata)
Update the client "Post a Load" form to label origin/destination as Loading Location (Pick Up) and Offloading Location (Drop Off)
Add an Admin button/link in the UI (e.g., header/nav or footer) that navigates to /admin
Add Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) to the list of service coverage countries displayed on the site (About/Services content)
Admin Dashboard: provide spreadsheet-style listings (and/or export) for signed-up Transporters and Clients, including all relevant details (including contract details) for admin viewing
Admin Dashboard: include an APK download link for the Android build artifact
Standardize load weight entry/calculation units to tonnage (tons) across the load posting and display flows

Extend Client and Transporter profiles to store admin-viewable contract details, and add the necessary backend admin-only query methods to retrieve spreadsheet-ready listings for all registered Clients and Transporters (including their contract details).
